column4: I have another question: is it possible to make xchat do a system beep when someone sends a message with your name in it? ;)
I created the original patch to do it, and it was ignoring. A while later they author did added the feature. It is currently called Beep on hilighted messages.
and I would just put Muleario in the "Extra words to highlight on" field?
No, it should just work. It auto highlights when someone says your nick
hmm it's not working...I wonder if perhaps I have system beeps disabled or something. Just upgraded to dapper two days ago
does your pc speaker work? Not sure if Ubuntu enables it by default.
you may need to modprobe pcspkr as root
I just did sudo modprobe pcspkr and there was no output
edgan: oh wow, it works now! Ha. is it on by default now or will I have to add this to sessions?
I guess it isn't. You will need to make sure the module is loaded on each boot
Not sure if Ubuntu has it's own way, but you could create rc.modules as a shell script to call modprobe pcspkr. I know Debian used to do it that way. You could also add it to rc.local.
I'm about to enter it as an entry in /etc/modules. should that work?
